meanings.definition: A person of great learning in several fields of study.
meanings.sent1: Many polymaths throughout history have excelled in multiple areas of knowledge.
meanings.sent2: The library was filled with books on various subjects, reflecting the interests of polymaths.
meanings.sent3: The polymaths at the science fair amazed everyone with their diverse range of projects.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a treasure trove, a polymath's paradise of information.
meanings.sent5: In the world of polymaths, curiosity is the key to unlocking endless possibilities.

meanings.definition: A person who has a wide range of knowledge.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather is a true polymath, always sharing interesting facts from different fields.
meanings.sent2: The polymath impressed everyone at the party with his ability to discuss any topic.
meanings.sent3: At the trivia night, the polymath surprised everyone by answering questions on every category.
meanings.sent4: Her brain was like a sponge, soaking up knowledge like a polymath in training.
meanings.sent5: The polymath's mind was a mosaic of information, each piece adding to the beautiful whole.
